title: "Wiped Off The Face Of The Earth": How Russia Erased A Ukrainian City
content: Vovchansk had a population of about 20,000 before the war. It now lives only in the memories of the survivors who managed to flee.
summary: Vovchansk had a population of about 20,000 before the war. It now lives only in the memories of the survivors who managed to flee.

title: Bidzina Ivanishvili, Secretive Billionaire Called Georgia's "Puppet Master"
content: When Georgia's richest man first burst into politics 12 years ago, he vowed to "astonish Europe" with the democracy he would bring to the Black Sea nation.
summary: When Georgia's richest man first burst into politics 12 years ago, he vowed to "astonish Europe" with the democracy he would bring to the Black Sea nation.

title: US Man Finds $20 On Ground, Buys Lottery Ticket And Wins $1 Million
content: When Jerry Hicks, a master carpenter from Banner Elk was headed to a convenience store, he found a $20 bill lying on the ground and then he won a lottery.
summary: When Jerry Hicks, a master carpenter from Banner Elk was headed to a convenience store, he found a $20 bill lying on the ground and then he won a lottery.

title: Iran Supreme Leader's Hebrew X Account Suspended, Last Post Was...
content: The Hebrew language account opened by Iran's leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on social media platform X has been suspended after just two posts, as per Jerusalem Post.
summary: The Hebrew language account opened by Iran's leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on social media platform X has been suspended after just two posts, as per Jerusalem Post.

title: Man Dials 911 Claiming A Bear Is Chasing Him. He's Now A Key Murder Suspect
content: The man called 911 and said that he had fallen off of a cliff while running from a bear and that he was injured and partially in the water, leading first responders to a dead body.
summary: The man called 911 and said that he had fallen off of a cliff while running from a bear and that he was injured and partially in the water, leading first responders to a dead body.

title: Egypt Proposes 2-Day Truce In Gaza With Limited Hostage-Prisoner Exchange
content: Egypt has proposed an initial two-day ceasefire in Gaza to exchange four Israeli hostages of Hamas for some Palestinian prisoners, Egypt's president said on Sunday as Israeli military strikes killed 45 Palestinians across the enclave.
summary: Egypt has proposed an initial two-day ceasefire in Gaza to exchange four Israeli hostages of Hamas for some Palestinian prisoners, Egypt's president said on Sunday as Israeli military strikes killed 45 Palestinians across the enclave.

title: Israel Army Says 5 Soldiers Killed In "Combat" In South Lebanon
content: The Israeli military on Sunday said five soldiers were killed in southern Lebanon, bringing to 37 the death toll for soldiers fighting there since the start of ground operations on September 30.
summary: The Israeli military on Sunday said five soldiers were killed in southern Lebanon, bringing to 37 the death toll for soldiers fighting there since the start of ground operations on September 30.

title: King Charles To Continue Foreign Tours After Being Diagnosed With Cancer
content: King Charles III's cancer diagnosis will not prevent him flying abroad next year for foreign visits, a Buckingham Palace official said, as the monarch wrapped up a tour of Australia and Samoa.
summary: King Charles III's cancer diagnosis will not prevent him flying abroad next year for foreign visits, a Buckingham Palace official said, as the monarch wrapped up a tour of Australia and Samoa.

title: US Man Sues Alaska Airlines After His Dog Dies During Flight
content: The sudden relocation caused significant distress to Ash, who began exhibiting signs of respiratory distress, including heavy panting and gasping for air.
summary: The sudden relocation caused significant distress to Ash, who began exhibiting signs of respiratory distress, including heavy panting and gasping for air.

title: Netanyahu Praises Israel's Strikes, Iran Warns Against "Exaggeration"
content: Israel's airstrikes "hit hard" Iran's defences and missile production, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday, but Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said the damage from Saturday's attack should not be exaggerated.
summary: Israel's airstrikes "hit hard" Iran's defences and missile production, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday, but Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said the damage from Saturday's attack should not be exaggerated.

title: Pakistan Requests $ 1.4 Billion Loan From China Amid Financial Challenges
content: In a bid to address its persistent external financing issues, Pakistan has formally requested a supplementary loan of 10 billion yuan (CNY) (approximately USD 1.4 billion) from China.
summary: In a bid to address its persistent external financing issues, Pakistan has formally requested a supplementary loan of 10 billion yuan (CNY) (approximately USD 1.4 billion) from China.

title: "Painful Concessions" Needed To Free Gaza Hostages: Israel Defence Minister
content: Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant warned Sunday that "painful concessions" would be needed to secure the release of hostages held in Gaza and that military action alone will not achieve the country's war aims.
summary: Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant warned Sunday that "painful concessions" would be needed to secure the release of hostages held in Gaza and that military action alone will not achieve the country's war aims.

title: Lebanon Says 8 Killed In Israel Strike Near Coastal City
content: Lebanon's health ministry said at least eight people were killed and 25 others wounded Sunday in an Israeli strike near the southern city of Sidon, where an AFP correspondent said a building was targeted.
summary: Lebanon's health ministry said at least eight people were killed and 25 others wounded Sunday in an Israeli strike near the southern city of Sidon, where an AFP correspondent said a building was targeted.

title: "My Father Was Killed": Netanyahu's Speech Interrupted By Protesters
content: Screaming relatives of Hamas attack victims interrupted a speech by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday during October 7 commemorations.
summary: Screaming relatives of Hamas attack victims interrupted a speech by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday during October 7 commemorations.

title: Over Rs 16 Lakh Raised For Family of Walmart Teen Found Dead In Oven
content: According to Halifax Regional Police, Ms Kaur was found dead inside an oven in the bakery section of a Halifax Walmart.
summary: According to Halifax Regional Police, Ms Kaur was found dead inside an oven in the bakery section of a Halifax Walmart.

title: Truck Rams Into Bus Stop In Israel's Tel Aviv, Dozens Injured
content: A truck rammed into a bus stop north of the commercial hub Tel Aviv on Sunday, injuring dozens of people.
summary: A truck rammed into a bus stop north of the commercial hub Tel Aviv on Sunday, injuring dozens of people.

title: Iranian Officials Will Decide How To Respond To Israel: Ayatollah Khamenei
content: Khamenei said Iran's power should be demonstrated to Israel, adding that the way to do so should be "determined by the officials and that which is in the best interest of the people and the country should take place".
summary: Khamenei said Iran's power should be demonstrated to Israel, adding that the way to do so should be "determined by the officials and that which is in the best interest of the people and the country should take place".

title: Who Is Tommy Robinson, Anti-Islam, Far-Right Activist Arrested In UK
content: Tommy Robinson, whose real name is Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, is once again making headlines as a prominent figure in the UK's far-right movement.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Bridging The Rhine And The Ganges: Germany's Renewed 'Focus India'
content: Following nuclear testing in 1998, the Singh-Talbott talks provided the framework for shifting the Indo-US relationship from "estranged democracies" to "engaged democracies."

title: Putin Vows To "Respond" If Ukraine Hits Russia With Long-Range Weapons
content: Russia's President Vladimir Putin said Moscow will use "a range of responses" if the United States and its NATO allies allow Ukraine to use Western long-range weapons to strike inside Russia.
summary: Russia's President Vladimir Putin said Moscow will use "a range of responses" if the United States and its NATO allies allow Ukraine to use Western long-range weapons to strike inside Russia.
